Jamal Hussan, Hassan Abu Baud, Saf[?]t Yuvis al Hussain, (Palestine) and Bashir Sadawi Bakhri, Sheik al Ardd, Mirkiuddiu Baud al Qawass, (Syrians) have ail obtained Saudi Arabia visas here and have applied to Consulate for transit visas for Koweit. I should welcome instructions as to whether I should forward their applications to the Resident, Persian Gulf, or whether, 'R' ends in view of the possibility that they will make mischief (e.g. see Damascus telegram to me of 4th October repeated to you as No. 67), British facilities should be refused. If transit visas for Koweit are refused, they may choose to travel by desert route from Najaf. addressed to Foreign ffice No. 379: repeated to Jerusalem No. 41, Resident Persian Gulf at Koweit and Beirut No. 6l.3997c 900 10.29 Previous File: P. Papers may be removed from or placed within this File only by the Political Registry.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Journey of certain Palestinian and Syrian Arabs to Saudi Arabia via Kuwait: question of grant of transit visas'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence relating to the issuing of transit visas for Kuwait for individuals from Palestine and Syria. The file includes deciphered telegrams on the subject, exchanged between Sir Basil Cochrane Newton (HM Ambassador to Iraq) and Cyril Prior (Political Resident in the Persian Gulf), and also contains a draft letter from Roland Tennyson Peel (Secretary for the Political Department in the India Office).
